definitions: To make someone feel unhappy or depressed.
To physically move from a higher position to a lower one.
To write something down; to record.
To swallow something, often with difficulty.
To start to seriously deal with or concentrate on something.
examples: This gloomy weather always gets me down.
Can you get down from there before you fall?
I need to get down these ideas before I forget them.
This pill is so big, I can barely get it down.
It's time to get down to business.
